00041 Signal::Signal(const std::string &filename, const std::string &sigmasFilename, const std::string &dirFileName, char displayMode)
00042 {
00043     m_signal = 0;
00044     m_interp = 0;
00045     m_sigmas = 0;
00046 
00047     m_displayMode = displayMode;
00048 
00049     m_directions = 0;
00050 
00051     m_N = 0;
00052 
00053 
00054     // Reading files
00055     Sequence::Pointer signal = this->readFiles(filename, sigmasFilename, dirFileName);
00056 
00057     // Getting images sizes
00058     SequenceRegion ssignalRegion = signal->GetLargestPossibleRegion();
00059 
00060     unsigned int xMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(0);
00061     unsigned int yMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(1);
00062     unsigned int zMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(2);
00063     unsigned int kMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(3);
00064 
00065     m_N = kMax;
00066 
00067     if(m_N != m_sigmas->size())
00068     {
00069         std::cout << "Error: there are " << m_N << " images and " << m_sigmas->size() << " sigmas !" << std::endl;
00070         std::exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00071     }
00072 
00073 //    std::cout << "\tThere are " << kMax << " images of size ";
00074 //    std::cout << xMax << "x" << yMax << "x" << zMax << "." << std::endl;
00075 
00076 
00077     // Allocate space memory for the array of images
00078 //    std::cout << "\tAllocating space memory..." << std::flush;
00079     m_signal = new Image::Pointer[kMax];
00080     m_interp = new ImageInterpolator::Pointer[kMax];
00081 //    std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00082 
00083 
00084 //    std::cout << "\tPreparing and interpolating data..." << std::flush;
00085 
00086     // Define images region
00087     ImageRegion iRegion;
00088 
00089     Image::IndexType iIndex;
00090     iIndex[0] = 0; iIndex[1] = 0; iIndex[2] = 0;
00091     iRegion.SetIndex(iIndex);
00092 
00093     Image::SizeType iSize;
00094     iSize[0] = xMax; iSize[1] = yMax; iSize[2] = zMax;
00095     iRegion.SetSize(iSize);
00096 
00097 
00098     // Define sequence region
00099     SequenceRegion sRegion;
00100 
00101     Sequence::SizeType sSize;
00102     sSize[0] = xMax; sSize[1] = yMax;
00103     sSize[2] = zMax; sSize[3] = 1;
00104     sRegion.SetSize(sSize);
00105 
00106 
00107     // Spacing and origin
00108     Sequence::SpacingType spacing = signal->GetSpacing();
00109     Sequence::PointType origin    = signal->GetOrigin();
00110 
00111     Image::SpacingType ispacing;
00112     ispacing[0] = spacing[0]; ispacing[1] = spacing[1]; ispacing[2] = spacing[2];
00113     Image::PointType iorigin;
00114     iorigin[0] = origin[0]; iorigin[1] = origin[1]; iorigin[2] = origin[2];
00115 
00116 
00117     // Put sequence in array of images
00118     for(unsigned int k=0; k<kMax; k++)
00119     {
00120         // Allocate space memory
00121         m_signal[k] = Image::New();
00122         m_signal[k]->SetRegions(iSize);
00123         m_signal[k]->SetOrigin(iorigin);
00124         m_signal[k]->SetSpacing(ispacing);
00125         m_signal[k]->Allocate();
00126 
00127         // Define correct sequence region
00128         Sequence::IndexType sIndex;
00129         sIndex[0] = 0; sIndex[1] = 0;
00130         sIndex[2] = 0; sIndex[3] = k;
00131         sRegion.SetIndex(sIndex);
00132 
00133         // Define iterators
00134         SequenceIterator sIt(signal, sRegion);
00135         ImageIterator iIt(m_signal[k], iRegion);
00136 
00137         // Copy data
00138         for(sIt.GoToBegin(), iIt.GoToBegin(); !sIt.IsAtEnd() && !iIt.IsAtEnd(); ++sIt, ++iIt)
00139             iIt.Set(sIt.Get());
00140 
00141         // Define interpolator
00142         m_interp[k] = ImageInterpolator::New();
00143         m_interp[k]->SetInputImage(m_signal[k]);
00144     } // for k
00145 
00146 //    std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00147 
00148 
00149 //    std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00150 }
00151 
00152 Signal::Signal(Sequence::Pointer signal, std::vector<Real> *sigmas, std::vector<Direction> *directions, char displayMode)
00153 {
00154     m_signal = 0;
00155     m_interp = 0;
00156     m_sigmas = sigmas;
00157 
00158     m_displayMode = displayMode;
00159 
00160     m_directions = directions;
00161 
00162 
00163     Display1(m_displayMode, std::cout << "Loading signal..." << std::endl);
00164 
00165     m_N = 0;
00166 
00167     // Getting images sizes
00168     SequenceRegion ssignalRegion = signal->GetLargestPossibleRegion();
00169 
00170     unsigned int xMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(0);
00171     unsigned int yMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(1);
00172     unsigned int zMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(2);
00173     unsigned int kMax = ssignalRegion.GetSize(3);
00174 
00175     m_N = kMax;
00176 
00177     if(m_N != m_sigmas->size())
00178     {
00179         std::cout << "Error: there are " << m_N << " images and " << m_sigmas->size() << " sigmas !" << std::endl;
00180         std::exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00181     }
00182 
00183     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << "\tThere are " << kMax << " images of size ");
00184     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << xMax << "x" << yMax << "x" << zMax << "." << std::endl);
00185 
00186 
00187     // Allocate space memory for the array of images
00188     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << "\tAllocating space memory..." << std::flush);
00189     m_signal = new Image::Pointer[kMax];
00190     m_interp = new ImageInterpolator::Pointer[kMax];
00191     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << "done." << std::endl);
00192 
00193 
00194     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << "\tPreparing and interpolating data..." << std::flush);
00195 
00196     // Define images region
00197     ImageRegion iRegion;
00198 
00199     Image::IndexType iIndex;
00200     iIndex[0] = 0; iIndex[1] = 0; iIndex[2] = 0;
00201     iRegion.SetIndex(iIndex);
00202 
00203     Image::SizeType iSize;
00204     iSize[0] = xMax; iSize[1] = yMax; iSize[2] = zMax;
00205     iRegion.SetSize(iSize);
00206 
00207 
00208     // Define sequence region
00209     SequenceRegion sRegion;
00210 
00211     Sequence::SizeType sSize;
00212     sSize[0] = xMax; sSize[1] = yMax;
00213     sSize[2] = zMax; sSize[3] = 1;
00214     sRegion.SetSize(sSize);
00215 
00216 
00217     // Spacing and origin
00218     Sequence::SpacingType spacing = signal->GetSpacing();
00219     Sequence::PointType origin    = signal->GetOrigin();
00220 
00221     Image::SpacingType ispacing;
00222     ispacing[0] = spacing[0]; ispacing[1] = spacing[1]; ispacing[2] = spacing[2];
00223     Image::PointType iorigin;
00224     iorigin[0] = origin[0]; iorigin[1] = origin[1]; iorigin[2] = origin[2];
00225 
00226     itk::Matrix<Real,3,3> dirMat;
00227     itk::Matrix<Real,4,4> iniMat = signal->GetDirection();
00228 
00229     dirMat(0,0) = iniMat(0,0);
00230     dirMat(0,1) = iniMat(0,1);
00231     dirMat(0,2) = iniMat(0,2);
00232 
00233     dirMat(1,0) = iniMat(1,0);
00234     dirMat(1,1) = iniMat(1,1);
00235     dirMat(1,2) = iniMat(1,2);
00236 
00237     dirMat(2,0) = iniMat(2,0);
00238     dirMat(2,1) = iniMat(2,1);
00239     dirMat(2,2) = iniMat(2,2);
00240 
00241 
00242     // Put sequence in array of images
00243     for(unsigned int k=0; k<kMax; k++)
00244     {
00245         // Allocate space memory
00246         m_signal[k] = Image::New();
00247         m_signal[k]->SetRegions(iSize);
00248         m_signal[k]->SetOrigin(iorigin);
00249         m_signal[k]->SetSpacing(ispacing);
00250         m_signal[k]->SetDirection(dirMat);
00251         m_signal[k]->Allocate();
00252 
00253         // Define correct sequence region
00254         Sequence::IndexType sIndex;
00255         sIndex[0] = 0; sIndex[1] = 0;
00256         sIndex[2] = 0; sIndex[3] = k;
00257         sRegion.SetIndex(sIndex);
00258 
00259         // Define iterators
00260         SequenceIterator sIt(signal, sRegion);
00261         ImageIterator iIt(m_signal[k], iRegion);
00262 
00263         // Copy data
00264         for(sIt.GoToBegin(), iIt.GoToBegin(); !sIt.IsAtEnd() && !iIt.IsAtEnd(); ++sIt, ++iIt)
00265             iIt.Set(sIt.Get());
00266 
00267         // Define interpolator
00268         m_interp[k] = ImageInterpolator::New();
00269         m_interp[k]->SetInputImage(m_signal[k]);
00270     } // for k
00271 
00272     Display2(m_displayMode, std::cout << "done." << std::endl);
00273 
00274 
00275     Display1(m_displayMode, std::cout << "done." << std::endl);
00276 }
00277 
00278 Signal::~Signal()
00279 {
00280     delete[] m_interp;
00281     delete[] m_signal;
00282 }
00283 
00284 Sequence::Pointer Signal::readFiles(const std::string &filename, const std::string &sigmasFilename, const std::string &dirFileName)
00285 {
00286 //    std::cout << "Loading signal file \"" << filename << "\"..." << std::endl;
00287 
00288     //
00289     // Read signal file
00290     //
00291 
00292 //        std::cout << "\tReading signal's file..." << std::flush;
00293         SequenceReader::Pointer reader = SequenceReader::New();
00294         reader->SetFileName(filename);
00295         reader->Update();
00296 //        std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00297 
00298 
00299     //
00300     // Read std deviance file
00301     //
00302 
00303 //        std::cout << "\tReading signal standard deviations' file..." << std::flush;
00304 
00305         // Open file
00306         std::fstream sigmasFile(sigmasFilename.c_str(), std::fstream::in);
00307 
00308         if(!sigmasFile.is_open())  // Unable to open file
00309         {
00310             std::cout << "Error: unable to read file !" << std::endl;
00311             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00312         }
00313         else                           // File is open
00314         {
00315             m_sigmas = new std::vector<Real>;
00316 
00317             Real sigma = 0;
00318 
00319             while(sigmasFile >> sigma)
00320                 m_sigmas->push_back(sigma);
00321         }
00322 
00323         // Close file
00324         sigmasFile.close();
00325 
00326 //        std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00327 
00328 
00329     //
00330     // Read direction's file
00331     //
00332 
00333 //        std::cout << "\tReading gradient directions' file..." << std::flush;
00334 
00335         // Open file
00336         std::fstream dirFile(dirFileName.c_str(), std::fstream::in);
00337 
00338         if(!dirFile.is_open())  // Unable to open file
00339         {
00340             std::cout << "Error: unable to read file !" << std::endl;
00341             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00342         }
00343         else                           // File is open
00344         {
00345             m_directions = new std::vector<Direction>;
00346 
00347             Real theta = 0, phi = 0;
00348 
00349             while((dirFile >> theta) && (dirFile >> phi))
00350                 m_directions->push_back(Direction(theta,phi));
00351         }
00352 
00353         // Close file
00354         dirFile.close();
00355 
00356 //        std::cout << "done." << std::endl;
00357 
00358 
00359     return reader->GetOutput();
00360 }
00361 
00362 Matrix Signal::signalAt(Point p)
00363 {
00364     Matrix S(m_N, 1);
00365 
00366     ImageInterpolator::ContinuousIndexType index;
00367     index[0] = p.x(); index[1] = p.y(); index[2] = p.z();
00368 
00369     for(unsigned int i=0; i<m_N; i++)
00370         S(i,0) = m_interp[i]->EvaluateAtContinuousIndex(index);
00371 
00372     return S;
00373 }
00374 
00375 std::vector<Real> *Signal::getSigmas()
00376 {
00377     return m_sigmas;
00378 }
00379 
00380 Image::SizeType Signal::getSize()
00381 {
00382     return m_signal[0]->GetLargestPossibleRegion().GetSize();
00383 }
00384 
00385 Image::PointType Signal::getOrigin()
00386 {
00387     return m_signal[0]->GetOrigin();
00388 }
00389 
00390 Image::SpacingType Signal::getSpacing()
00391 {
00392     return m_signal[0]->GetSpacing();
00393 }
00394 
00395 Image::DirectionType Signal::getDirection()
00396 {
00397     return m_signal[0]->GetDirection();
00398 }
00399 
00400 std::vector<Direction> *Signal::getDirections()
00401 {
00402     return m_directions;
00403 }
